title: In Android, SKGLView' PaintSurface occuring after first page render
body:
Create a Xamarin Form page that contains a SKGlView and a Button with a text.
Implement SKGlView's PaintSurface, with a simple drawing (like clear in red)
Run

Expected:
When page is rendered for the first time, SKGlView's PaintSurface has already been called.
So on first frame, button is shown and SKGLView is all red.

Result:
When page is rendered, SKGlView's PaintSurface has NOT been called YET.
So on first frame, button is shown, but SKGLView is still white.
SKGlView will become red (ie PaintSurface called) only after few milliseconds.
As a result a kind of annoying blinking occures.

Note : When using a SKCanvasView (instead of SKGlView) , problem does not occure.
SKCanvasView's PAintSurface is called before page is rendered, which is expected behavior.

Do you confirm it is an issue?
Should I post some code to make it clearer?
